title: 115_hr3077
content: The Act titled "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals the Retirement Earnings Test. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals various subsections of the Social Security Act, including redesignating and amending certain sections for conformity. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals and amends subsections of the Social Security Act for conformity, including changes to sections related to benefits termination upon deportation and exemptions from reductions based on early retirement. Provisions in the Social Security Act are amended to exempt certain deductions based on early retirement and disregard of entitlements to child's insurance benefits. Amendments are made to the Social Security Act regarding exemptions for deductions based on early retirement and disregard of entitlements to child's insurance benefits. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to provisions related to reductions in benefits, penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings, and considerations of earnings in determining benefits. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to provisions related to deductions from benefits based on work, earnings considerations in benefit computation years, rounding of benefits, and defining income for purposes of SSI. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to provisions related to deductions from benefits based on work, earnings considerations in benefit computation years, rounding of benefits, and defining income for purposes of SSI. The term 'wages' is redefined for SSI purposes as wages defined in section 209, without certain limitations on remuneration amounts specified in section 209(a). Services not constituting employment as defined in section 210 are also considered in this computation. For SSI purposes, employment within or outside the US is defined based on remuneration inclusion in net earnings. Wages exclude certain payments related to retirement or termination. The text discusses the termination of an employee's employment due to retirement at a specified age in a pension plan. It also mentions the repeal of deductions on work under the Railroad Retirement Program. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years ending after December 31, 2018.
